Description: Rim sherd of Chian pottery Type B1 kantharos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky brown below; part of elaborate rosette in added white outline with added red centres; top of rim glazed; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis) (noted in Gardner's plate)
Curator's comments: The number 38 is written in pencil on the interior surface of the sherd. Kantharoi Type B1 usually have lotus flowers and lotus buds on the interior above two white bands (Williams 1983, 169). Unlike most kantharoi, this one was decorated with at least one rosette. Many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim and several have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis. Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 169, no. 173)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 681, no. 396, pl. 24.1.33)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1850) (phase 2)
